intro: Pachystemon depressus, commonly known as the flatstem pachystemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, often with a bluish-green hue. It blooms in spring and summer, producing clusters of bright pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
